smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'FragmentBuildersModule' with '13' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'HardwareInfoViewModel' with '13' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'ApplicationsFragment' with '13' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
File 'Extensions.kt' with '13' functions detected. Defined threshold inside files is set to '11'

smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function getSensorData appears to be too complex.
The function getBatteryStatus appears to be too complex.
The function getItem appears to be too complex.
The function getPageTitle appears to be too complex.
The function parsePs appears to be too complex.
The function onBindViewHolder appears to be too complex.

smells.name: LargeClass
smells.description: One class should have one responsibility. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. Split up large classes into smaller classes that are easier to understand.

instances.message: Class HardwareInfoViewModel is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.

smells.name: NestedBlockDepth
smells.description: Excessive nesting leads to hidden complexity. Prefer extracting code to make it easier to understand.

instances.message: Function getCpuInfoFromFile is nested too deeply.

smells.name: MatchingDeclarationName
smells.description: If a source file contains only a single non-private top-level class or object, the file name should reflect the case-sensitive name plus the .kt extension.

instances.message: The file name 'AppInjectior.kt' does not match the name of the single top-level declaration 'AppInjector'.

smells.name: FunctionMaxLength
smells.description: Function names should not be longer than the maximum set in the project configuration.

instances.message: Function names should be at most 30 characters long.

smells.name: ObjectPropertyNaming
smells.description: Property names inside objects should follow the naming convention set in the projects configuration.

instances.message: Private object property names should match the pattern: (_)?[A-Za-z][A-Za-z0-9]*

smells.description: Cast operator throws an exception if the cast is not possible.

smells.name: ExplicitGarbageCollectionCall
smells.description: Don't try to be smarter than the JVM. Your code should work independently if the garbage collector is disabled or not. If you face memory issues, try tuning the JVM options instead of relying on code itself.

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

instances.message: androidx.test.espresso.matcher.ViewMatchers.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
java.io.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
java.io.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
android.view.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
com.kgurgul.cpuinfo.utils.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
android.view.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.

smells.name: UnnecessaryAbstractClass
smells.description: An abstract class is unnecessary and can be refactored. An abstract class should have both abstract and concrete properties or functions. An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface. An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.

instances.message: An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface.
An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.
